title: Bouchards Six Point Night Leads Oilers to 6 5 Overtime Win Over
snippets: Connor McDavid scored 46 seconds into overtime and the Edmonton Oilers held on for a wild 6-5 win over the Washington Capitals on Saturday.
These are the nights when you wonder how Evan Bouchard doesn’t make every team that ever was picked.
Watch as Edmonton Oilers defenceman Evan Bouchard lights the lamp three times against the Washington Capitals, becoming the franchise’s first blue-liner to score a hat trick in 20 years.

Connor McDavid scored 46 seconds into overtime, Evan Bouchard had his first NHL hat trick and three assists, and the Edmonton Oilers held on for a 6-5 win over the Washington Capitals on Saturday night. Bouchard's six-point game came in his 400th regular-season contest. McDavid had a goal and three

Evan Bouchard recorded a hat trick and finished with six points, Connor McDavid put up five points including the overtime winner, and Leon Draisaitl dished out three assists to elevate the Edmonton Oilers to a 6-5 win over the Washington Capitals.
Morgan Geekie scored twice, Charlie McAvoy dished out three assists, and Fraser Minten finished with two points to elevate the Boston Bruins to a 4-3 victory over the Montreal Canadiens.
J.T. Compher buried a pair of goals, while Marco Kasper and Lucas Raymond each had a goal and an assist to help lead the Detroit Red Wings past the Winnipeg Jets 5-1.
Brandon Bussi stopped 35 shots and Seth Jarvis scored a highlight-reel goal to lift the Carolina Hurricanes to a 4-1 win over the Ottawa Senators on Saturday.
The Buffalo Sabres tallied five goals, including two from Jason Zucker while Alex Lyon made 27 saves to earn the shutout as the Buffalo Sabres beat New York Islanders 5-0.

Brad Marchand finished with three points, including the game-winning goal in overtime while Carter Verhaeghe and Matthew Tkachuk each added two assists to lead the Florida Panthers to a 4-3 win over the Minnesota Wild.
Mason Marchment scored a hat trick to propel the Columbus Blue Jackets to an 8-5 win over the Tampa Bay Lightning on Saturday.
Mikhail Sergachev tallied three assists as Kailer Yamamoto netted the game-winning goal to lead the Utah Mammoth over the Nashville Predators 5-2.
Taylor Ward opened the scoring, Alex Laferriere had a goal and an assist and Trevor Moore buried the shootout winner to lift the Los Angeles Kings past the St. Louis Blues 5-4.

title: Chicago Bulls Retire Derrick Roses No. 1 Jersey After Win Over Celtics
snippets: The Chicago Bulls retired Derrick Rose's No. 1 jersey after Saturday's 106-103 victory against the Boston Celtics, and the former guard grew emotional throughout the ceremony.
The Chicago Bulls have retired Derrick Rose's No 1 jersey in an emotional ceremony after the 106-103 victory over the Boston Celtics on Saturday night.
The Chicago Bulls honored Derrick Rose by retiring his No. 1 jersey on Saturday night.
No. 1 will always be from Chicago.
The Bulls stayed in playoff contention on a night when the team honored former NBA MVP Derrick Rose by retiring his jersey No. 1.

CHICAGO (AP) — Kevin Huerter made a 3-pointer just before the buzzer, lifting the Chicago Bulls past the Boston Celtics 114-111 before retiring Derrick Rose’s jersey number on Saturday night. Coby White scored 22 points and hit five of Chicago’s 21 3s, helping the Bulls win their fourth straight. Rose entered rarified air after the game when the Bulls sent his No. 1 to the rafters, putting the Chicago product alongside Michael Jordan, Scottie Pippen, Jerry Sloan and Bob Love as the only players with numbers retired by the team. The Bulls gave their crowd plenty to cheer before they honored...
